Class Player

java.lang.Object
engine.forPlayer.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlackPlayer, WhitePlayer
public abstract class Player extends Object
The Player class represents an abstract chess player, providing the foundation for player-specific operations and game state management. Each player is associated with a board position and maintains their king piece, legal moves, and check status. The class handles move execution, validation, and state queries including checkmate, stalemate, and castling status. Concrete subclasses must implement alliance-specific behavior for piece management and castling calculations.
Author:
Aaron Ho, dareTo81

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      Player(Board board, Collection<Move> playerLegals, Collection<Move> opponentLegals)
      Constructs a Player with the specified board and move collections. Establishes the player's king, determines check status, and calculates all legal moves including castling options.
      Parameters:
      board - The chessboard associated with this player.
      playerLegals - The collection of standard legal moves for this player.
      opponentLegals - The collection of legal moves for the opponent player.

  • Method Details

    • isInCheck

      public boolean isInCheck()
      Determines whether this player is currently in check.
      Returns:
      True if the player is in check, false otherwise.

    • isInCheckMate

      public boolean isInCheckMate()
      Determines whether this player is in checkmate. A player is in checkmate if they are in check and have no legal escape moves.
      Returns:
      True if the player is in checkmate, false otherwise.

    • isInStaleMate

      public boolean isInStaleMate()
      Determines whether this player is in stalemate. A player is in stalemate if they are not in check but have no legal moves.
      Returns:
      True if the player is in stalemate, false otherwise.

    • isCastled

      public boolean isCastled()
      Determines whether this player has castled.
      Returns:
      True if the player has castled, false otherwise.

    • getPlayerKing

      public King getPlayerKing()
      Retrieves this player's king piece.
      Returns:
      The king piece belonging to this player.

    • establishKing

      private King establishKing()
      Establishes the king piece for this player by locating it among active pieces.
      Returns:
      The king piece belonging to this player.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If no king piece is found among active pieces.

    • hasEscapeMoves

      private boolean hasEscapeMoves()
      Determines whether this player has any legal escape moves available.
      Returns:
      True if escape moves exist, false otherwise.

    • getLegalMoves

      public Collection<Move> getLegalMoves()
      Retrieves the collection of legal moves for this player.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable collection of legal moves.

    • calculateAttacksOnTile

      public static Collection<Move> calculateAttacksOnTile(int tile, Collection<Move> moves)
      Calculates all moves that attack a specific tile on the board.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile coordinate to check for attacks.
      moves - The collection of moves to examine.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable collection of moves that attack the specified tile.

    • makeMove

      public MoveTransition makeMove(Move move)
      Executes a move and returns the resulting board transition. Validates the move legality and ensures the move does not leave the player in check.
      Parameters:
      move - The move to execute.
      Returns:
      A MoveTransition object containing the resulting board state and move status.

    • unMakeMove

      public MoveTransition unMakeMove(Move move)
      Undoes a move and returns the previous board state.
      Parameters:
      move - The move to undo.
      Returns:
      A MoveTransition object containing the previous board state.

    • getActivePieces

      public abstract Collection<Piece> getActivePieces()
      Retrieves the collection of active pieces belonging to this player. Must be implemented by concrete subclasses to return alliance-specific pieces.
      Returns:
      The collection of active pieces for this player.

    • getAlliance

      public abstract Alliance getAlliance()
      Retrieves the alliance (color) of this player. Must be implemented by concrete subclasses to return the appropriate alliance.
      Returns:
      The alliance of this player.

    • getOpponent

      public abstract Player getOpponent()
      Retrieves the opponent player. Must be implemented by concrete subclasses to return the opposing player.
      Returns:
      The opponent player.

    • calculateKingCastles

      protected abstract Collection<Move> calculateKingCastles(Collection<Move> playerLegals, Collection<Move> opponentLegals)
      Calculates and returns possible castling moves for this player's king. Must be implemented by concrete subclasses to handle alliance-specific castling rules.
      Parameters:
      playerLegals - The legal moves available to this player.
      opponentLegals - The legal moves available to the opponent.
      Returns:
      A collection of possible castling moves.

    • hasCastleOpportunities

      protected boolean hasCastleOpportunities()
      Determines whether this player has any castling opportunities available. A player has castling opportunities if they are not in check, have not already castled, and retain either kingside or queenside castling capabilities.
      Returns:
      True if castling opportunities exist, false otherwise.
